clinical_study.brief_title: Survey of the Anxiety Associated With the SARS-CoV-2 Pandemic
clinical_study.official_title: Online-based Survey of the Anxiety Associated With the SARS-CoV-2 Pandemic in the General Population in Germany

brief_summary.textblock:
The study aims to systematically examine various aspects of the anxiety associated with the
      SARS-CoV-2 pandemic in Germany. The data collection is carried out online with longitudinal
      repeated measurements.

detailed_description.textblock:
The SARS-CoV-2-pandemic is currently one of the greatest challenges for numerous countries -
      also for Germany. In addition to its somatic and economic consequences, the psychological
      dimension of SARS-CoV-2 is discussed increasingly and is visible in public life - e.g. in the
      "pandemic-caused experience of threat", "loss of control" and "panic" of multiple people. The
      study examines the phenomenon of this "corona-related anxiety" in terms of epidemiological,
      clinical and psychosocial characteristics. It is investigated how "corona anxiety" affects
      people who already have an anxiety disorder or other mental illnesses as well as formerly
      mentally healthy people. It is also examined how media reporting and personal consequences of
      SARS-CoV-2 are related to corona-related anxiety and if there is a need for therapeutic
      support regarding corona-related anxiety.

      To answer these questions a longitudinal online survey targeting the general population in
      Germany is carried out. The survey takes place all three weeks as long as the pandemic lasts
      and ends with one follow-up one year later.

primary_outcome.description: To investigate specific fears regarding the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic 9 self created items are used. Values ranging from 1 to 6, higher scores indicate a worse outcome.

Modified German version of the DSM-5 Severity-Measure-For-Specific-Phobia-Adult-Scale by Beesdo-Baum et al. (2014). 10 items, values ranging from 1 to 5, higher scores indicate a worse outcome. The Scale was adapted to anxiety symptoms related to SARS-CoV-2.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day + every 3 weeks as long as the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic lasts (maximum: 30 weeks from baseline on) and one year later (Follow-Up)
secondary_outcome.description: Self-efficacy and coping with the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic are measured with 13 self created items. Values ranging from 1 to 6; higher scores indicate a better outcome (except inverted items).

secondary_outcome.measure: Consequences of SARS-CoV-2 in the last three weeks.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day + every 3 weeks as long as the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic lasts (maximum: 30 weeks from baseline on) and one year later (Follow-Up)
secondary_outcome.description: Personal consequences of the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic in the last three weeks are collected with five self-created items.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day + every 3 weeks as long as the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic lasts (maximum: 30 weeks from baseline on) and one year later (Follow-Up)
secondary_outcome.description: General illness attitudes are measured with 3 subscales (Worry about illness; Thanatophobia; Bodily preoccupations) of the German version of the Illness Attitude Scales (IAS) by Hiller & Rief (2004). 9 Items; values ranging from 1 to 5, higher scores indicate a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day + every 3 weeks as long as the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic lasts (maximum: 30 weeks from baseline on) and one year later (Follow-Up)
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency, effects and formats of consumed media related to SARS-CoV-2 are measured with 5 self created items.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ultra-brief screening scale for anxiety and depression
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day + every 3 weeks as long as the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic lasts (maximum: 30 weeks from baseline on) and one year later (Follow-Up)
secondary_outcome.description: To screen for general anxiety and depressive symptoms the German version of the Patient Health Questionnaire-4 (PHQ-4) by Löwe (2015) is used. 4 items; values ranging from 0 to 3, higher scores indicate a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in characteristics of SARS-CoV-2-related anxiety
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 3 weeks as long as the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic lasts (maximum: 30 weeks from baseline on) and one year later (Follow-Up)
secondary_outcome.description: To investigate specific fears regarding the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic 9 self created items are used. Values ranging from 1 to 6, higher scores indicate a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 3 weeks as long as the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic lasts (maximum: 30 weeks from baseline on) and one year later (Follow-Up)
secondary_outcome.description: Modified German version of the DSM-5 Severity-Measure-For-Specific-Phobia-Adult-Scale by Beesdo-Baum et al. (2014). 10 items, values ranging from 1 to 5, higher scores indicate a worse outcome. The Scale was adapted to anxiety symptoms related to SARS-CoV-2.

clinical_study.condition: Anxiety Related to the SARS-CoV-2 Pandemic

arm_group.description: Reasonably large and representative sample of the general population in Germany

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  informed consent was given

          -  age ≥ 18

          -  able to complete the questionnaire in German

          -  country of residence: Germany

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  if at least one of the inclusion criteria is not met
